title: Test Quarto Pixi CI w/ Multiple Environments
text:
This repository demonstrates how to create a of coding tutorial website that (hopefully) reduces barriers to user contributions.
Key characteristics:

The website is composed of static pages and is built by the Quarto publishing system.
Website updates are triggered by a GitHub Action.
Static files are hosted on GitHub pages.
Each tutorial has a separate coding environment, allowing the use of different versions of libraries (or even different languages). Versioned libraries are defined by a configuration file within the tutorial folders.

Example for Tutorial 1
Example for Tutorial 2

To execute code within the tutorials, users can either:

Download the Jupyter notebook and install dependencies in a local environment.
Launch an online execution environment (GitHub Codespace) that includes a container configured for the tutorial (Container Configuration)
